Vietnam plans union reform to avert trade woes, risking foreign firms' uneaseCommunist-ruled Vietnam is expected to ratify this year the UN convention for the free establishment of trade unions, UN officials and diplomats said, in a move meant to cut risks of trade disputes but likely leaving some foreign companies uneasy. China's COMAC to showcase C919, ARJ21 jets in 5 Southeast Asian countriesChinese state-owned planemaker COMAC will conduct flying displays of its C919 and ARJ21 jets in five Southeast Asian countries, it said on Tuesday, as it looks to lay the groundwork for future international sales.
